newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Hansapank 96 non-cons net 234 mln kroons.
newsitem.headline: Hansapank 96 non-cons net 234 mln kroons.

text.p: Estonia's leading bank, Hansapank, on Thursday said its 1996 non-consolidated net profit was 234.4 million kroons versus 149.7 million kroons in 1995.
The bank said in a statement that its assets in 1996 rose to 5.54 billion kroons versus 3.38 billion kroons.
The bank said that net interest income in 1996 came to 280.7 million kroons versus 191.2 million kroons while financial income came to 267.3 million kroons versus 106.3 million kroons.
The bank added that income from fees and commissions was 137.5 million kroons versus 92 million kroons.
Total revenue therefore rose to 678.1 million kroons from 404.8 million kroons.
It also said that service fees paid came to 41.6 million kroons versus 28.1 million kroons.
The bank also said that its personnel expenses were 109 million kroons, up from 71.9 million kroons, administration costs of 80.5 million kroons, up from 64.9 million kroons.
This meant total expenses of 371.6 million kroons and net operating revenue of 306.4 million kroons versus 195.8 million kroons.
The bank also said it had deposits of 3.30 billion kroons versus 3.03 billion kroons and had extended net credits of 3.22 billion kroons versus 2.96 billion kroons.
It said its return on equity came to 45.70 percent and its return on assets was 5.38 percent.
